comments: This is the minimal recursive sequence such that a(1)=7, A007814(a(n))= A007814(n) and A010060(a(n))=A010060(n). - _Vladimir Shevelev_, Apr 23 2009
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..4095
example: 30 in binary is 11110, so 30 is in sequence.
prog: (PARI) a(n)=n+6*2^floor(log(n)/log(2))(Haskell)import Data.List (transpose)a004759 n = a004759_list !! (n-1)a004759_list = 7 : concat (transpose [zs, map (+ 1) zs])                   where zs = map (* 2) a004759_list-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 03 2015
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
